titles.title: Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (S. 1214) to amend the Merchant Marine Act, 1936, to establish a program to ensure greater security for United States seaports, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-780, by Mr. Diaz-Balart.
Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to S. 1214.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 237.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 605.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/13/2002--Reported to House without amendment. Waives points of order against the conference report to accompany S. 1214 (establishing a program to ensure greater security for U.S. seaports).
